description: From be- +‎ wreck. Compare Old English bewrecan (“to drive or bring to”). More at be-, wreck.

verbs.description: bewreck (third-person singular simple present bewrecks, present participle bewrecking, simple past and past participle bewrecked or (obsolete) bewreckt)

entries.meaning: (transitive, dialectal) To wreck completely; ruin; destroy.
examples: Yet was I, or I parted thence, bewreckt.
